de.esoco.process

Class Process

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obrel.core.RelatedObject
      • org.obrel.core.SerializableRelatedObject
        • de.esoco.process.Process
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.obrel.core.Relatable

    public class Process
extends org.obrel.core.SerializableRelatedObject
    Models processes that consist of ProcessStep instances. Process instances are created from a ProcessDefinition instance through the ProcessManager class. To run a process it's execute() method must be invoked. A process can only be run once. After it's execution has either finished completely or after it has been canceled it cannot be executed again. To re-execute a process a new process instance needs to be created first.

    Processes can be identified by their name which may be identical for multiple instances (stored in StandardTypes.NAME) and by a unique ID (stored in ProcessRelationTypes.PROCESS_ID.

    The state of a process and it's steps is defined with parameters that must be set on the process instance. These parameters are stored as relations of the process context and the types of the process parameter are therefore defined as relation types. The process parameters can either be accessed through the standard relation access methods or, for better readability, through corresponding methods like getParameter(RelationType).

    Processes can be hierarchical which means that a process step can invoke a sub-process (see SubProcessStep for details). A sub-process will run in the context of the parent process, i.e. it will automatically access the parameters of the process it had been invoked from. The own parameters of a sub-process will be ignored in such a case.

    Processes that require additional input may contain interactive process steps. Such steps have a relation of the type MetaTypes.INTERACTIVE. For such steps two different interaction models are supported. The first of these requires an instance of the ProcessInteractionHandler interface to be set on the process which will then be invoked for each interactive step.

    Alternatively, if no interaction handler is set, the process execution will terminate after invoking ProcessStep.prepareParameters() but before the execution of each interactive step and return the step. The calling context must then handle the necessary interaction and call the execute() method of the process again after providing the necessary parameters to the returned step. This must be repeated until the process execution returns NULL.

    Processes are serializable. This is not intended for long-term persistence of processes but only for the temporary storage of processes, e.g. during the deactivation of a server session that uses a process. The serialization format is not guaranteed and may be different in future versions.

    If an interaction handler is set on a process that is to be serialized it must be serializable too, else an exception will occur on serialization. All process steps are serializable by default, so ProcessStep subclasses must implement proper serialization for their own fields. Serialization is inherited from the base class SerializableRelatedObject, so all relations that are set on a process to be serialized must either have a target object that is serializable too or a type that is declared as transient (with the flag RelationTypeModifier.TRANSIENT).

    Setting the flag MetaTypes.TRANSACTIONAL on a process will cause the process execution to be wrapped in a transaction that will be committed if the process is finished successfully. If the process execution fails or is canceled the transaction will be rolled back.

    If the flag HistoryManager.HISTORIZED is set on a process it will create a history group for the process execution so that all history records created by process steps will be added to that group. If the process has an entity parameter of type HistoryRecord.TARGET it will be used as the target for the history group. A historized process is always also transactional.

    To be notified of process state changes an application can register an instance of a ProcessListener implementation by adding it to the listener relation with the type ProcessRelationTypes.PROCESS_LISTENERS. Calls to the listener interface occur inside the process transaction so that any transactional code inside the listener will be part of the transaction unless the listener explicitly avoids the process transaction. Only if the process is canceled or fails the calls to the corresponding listener methods will occur after the transaction has been rolled back to allow the listener to record information about the process termination.

    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • PROCESS_END

        public static final java.lang.String PROCESS_END
        Next step signal value for a process end-point
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • addCleanupAction

        public void addCleanupAction(java.lang.String sKey,
                             java.util.function.Consumer<Process> fAction)
        Registers an cleanup action that will be executed when this process is finished, either by completing regularly (including cancelation) or by handling an error. If a different finish action is already registered under a particular key it will be replaced. Therefore invoking code must make sure to use unique keys or handle the replacement of actions in appropriate ways.

        When invoked a cleanup action receives the associated process instance as it's argument to provide access to process parameters. Registered Actions can be removed with removeCleanupAction(String).

        Parameters:
        sKey - A key that identifies the action for later removal
        fAction - The function to invoke on cleanup

      • addInteractionCleanupAction

        public void addInteractionCleanupAction(java.lang.Runnable fAction)
        Adds an action that will be performed once before the next process execution after an interaction. After execution it will be removed from the list of cleanup actions.
        Parameters:
        fAction - A function performing the cleanup action
        See Also:
        executeInteractionCleanupActions()

      • canRollbackTo

        public boolean canRollbackTo(ProcessStep rStep)
        Checks whether this process can be rolled back to a certain step. An application should invoke the method rollbackTo(ProcessStep) for a certain step only if this method returns TRUE for that step. Else the rollback invocation will throw an exception.

        This method is intended to be used with interactive processes that suspend execution when reaching interactive process steps. If the process has already finished execution when this method is invoked it returns FALSE.

        Parameters:
        rStep - The step to check
        Returns:
        TRUE if a rollback to the given step is possible, FALSE if not

      • canRollbackToPreviousInteraction

        public boolean canRollbackToPreviousInteraction()
        Checks whether this process can be rolled back to a previously executed interactive step. Invokes the method canRollbackTo(ProcessStep) if a previously executed interactive step could be found on the execution stack.

        The method rollbackToPreviousInteraction() should only be invoked by an application after checking that this method returns TRUE. Otherwise the rollback method may throw an exception.

        Returns:
        TRUE if a rollback to a previously executed interactive step is possible, FALSE if not

      • getContext

        public final Process getContext()
        Returns the context this process runs in. This will either be this process itself or, in the case of sub-processes, the enclosing process context.
        Returns:
        The process context

      • getCurrentStep

        public ProcessStep getCurrentStep()
        This method returns the current process step. It has been implemented for the use of interactive process steps. Returns NULL when no further steps will follow.
        Returns:
        The current step

      • getInteractionStep

        public ProcessStep getInteractionStep()
        This method returns the process step for the latest interaction of this process. It will only return a valid result if the process has previously been executed but the method isFinished() still returns FALSE.
        Returns:
        The interaction step or NULL for none

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this process as stored in the process parameter StandardTypes.NAME. This name represents the process class and may be the same for different process instances. For a unique process name see the method getUniqueProcessName().
        Returns:
        The process name

      • getNextFragmentId

        public int getNextFragmentId()
        Returns an integer ID for the automatic naming of process fragments. This method is intended to be used internally by the framework.
        Returns:
        The next generated fragment ID

      • getParameter

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Indicates whether the process has finished execution or not.
        Returns:

        Checks whether this process is running in the context of another process or if is a root process.
        Returns:

      • lockEntity

        public final boolean lockEntity(Entity rEntity)
        Tries to acquire a modification lock on an entity for the remaining execution of this process. If successful, a cleanup action will be registered with addCleanupAction(String, Consumer) that removes the lock if the process is finished.
        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to lock
        Returns:
        TRUE if the lock could be acquired, FALSE if the entity is already locked

      • removeCleanupAction

        public java.util.function.Consumer<Process> removeCleanupAction(java.lang.String sKey)
        Removes a cleanup action that has previously been registered through the method addCleanupAction(String, Consumer).
        Parameters:
        sKey - The key that identifies the action to remove
        Returns:
        The registered action or NULL for none

      • removeEntityModificationLock

        public de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super Entity> removeEntityModificationLock()
        Removes the current entity modification lock rule by invoking the method EntityManager.removeEntityModificationLock(String) with the ID of this process.
        Returns:
        The removed lock rule or NULL for none

      • removeParameter

        public void removeParameter(org.obrel.core.RelationType<?> rParamType)
        Removes a certain parameter from the process. If the parameter doesn't exist the call is ignored.
        Parameters:
        rParamType - The type of the parameter

      • setEntityModificationLock

        public void setEntityModificationLock(de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super Entity> pLockRule)
        Sets an entity modification lock rule through the entity manager method EntityManager.setEntityModificationLock(String, Predicate). If a lock rule already exists it will be combined with the new rule with an or join. If that is not desired the current rule must be removed by invoking removeEntityModificationLock().

        All rules set from a process instance will be automatically removed if a process execution ends in any way, i.e. successfully, by cancellation, or with an error.

        Parameters:
        pLockRule - The entity modification lock rule

      • setInteractionHandler

        public void setInteractionHandler(ProcessInteractionHandler rHandler)
        Sets the process interaction handler for this context.
        Parameters:
        rHandler - The new interaction handler

      • setParameter

        public <T> org.obrel.core.Relation<T> setParameter(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rParam,
                                                   T rValue)
        Sets a process parameter. If the parameter already exists it's value will be replaced.
        Parameters:
        rParam - The parameter
        rValue - The parameter value
        Returns:
        The relation of the parameter

      • unlockEntity

        public final void unlockEntity(Entity rEntity)
        Removes an entity lock that had been acquired by a successful call to lockEntity(Entity). This will also remove the associated cleanup action.
        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to unlock
